about.description:
webargs is a Python library for parsing HTTP request arguments, with
built-in support for popular web frameworks, including Flask, Django,
Bottle, Tornado, Pyramid, webapp2, Falcon, and aiohttp.
about.summary: A friendly library for parsing HTTP request arguments, with built-in support for popular web frameworks

name: webargs
raw_recipe:
{% set name = "webargs" %}
{% set version = "1.5.3" %}
{% set sha256 = "bc6d1c7b2433fc17d7fd86ced48d7fc8a8df5919a3742b8540ec3c0a0fe3e985" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 0
  script: python setup.py install --single-version-externally-managed --record record.txt

requirements:
  build:
    - python
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python
    - marshmallow >=2.0.0

test:
  imports:
    - webargs

about:
  home: https://github.com/sloria/webargs
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'A friendly library for parsing HTTP request arguments, with built-in support for popular web frameworks'

  description: |
    webargs is a Python library for parsing HTTP request arguments, with
    built-in support for popular web frameworks, including Flask, Django,
    Bottle, Tornado, Pyramid, webapp2, Falcon, and aiohttp.
  doc_url: http://webargs.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/sloria/webargs

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - frol

about.description:
webargs is a Python library for parsing HTTP request arguments, with
built-in support for popular web frameworks, including Flask, Django,
Bottle, Tornado, Pyramid, webapp2, Falcon, and aiohttp.
about.summary: A friendly library for parsing HTTP request arguments, with built-in support for popular web frameworks
